description: System-generated unique identifier for the contact record; primary key for joins.
Business/legacy identifier code for the contact, typically user-facing and shorter than the primary key; confirm uniqueness rules with SME.
Name or descriptive label of the contact (company or person).
Job title or role of the person at the contact organization.
Status code indicating the contact’s lifecycle state (e.g., active, inactive, vendor). Values are enumerated; confirm code set with SME.
Flag indicating whether this contact’s costs can be charged to work orders.
Flag indicating whether the contact is allowed to be used on purchase orders (approved vendor).
Social Security Number for an employee/individual contact; highly sensitive PII; mask and restrict access.
Date the individual contact began employment.
Date the individual’s employment ended.
Scheduled or last performance review date for the employee contact.
Scheduled or last pay increase effective date for the employee contact.
Seniority start date used for tenure calculations; confirm exact business meaning with SME.
Date of birth for the individual contact; PII.
Gender code for the individual; enumerated values; confirm allowed codes and meanings with SME.
Available sick leave balance for the employee contact, typically in hours; confirm unit with SME.
Available vacation leave balance, typically in hours; confirm unit with SME.
Available balance for other leave category (e.g., personal time); confirm category with SME.
Sick leave used to date within the current accrual period or year; confirm period with SME.
Vacation leave used to date within the current accrual period or year; confirm period with SME.
Other leave used to date within the current accrual period or year; confirm period with SME.
Total overtime hours worked year-to-date for the employee contact.
Federal tax identification number for the contact (EIN/TIN); sensitive; mask and secure.
Currency code used for this contact’s financial transactions (e.g., ISO 4217).
Minimum purchase value required by the vendor before accepting orders.
Payment terms code applied to purchase orders for this vendor; references the terms master.
Preferred shipping method or carrier code for orders placed with this vendor.
Shipping terms or responsibilities code (e.g., Incoterms or prepaid/collect); confirm exact interpretation with SME.
Freight payment responsibility code indicating who pays freight charges; confirm code set with SME.
Free-text specifications, notes, or requirements associated with the contact (e.g., vendor capabilities or certifications).
Organizational department associated with the employee contact; used for reporting and permissions.
Skill level rating or classification for the employee contact; used for assignments or labor costing.
Code indicating how labor or services are costed for this contact (e.g., actual vs. standard); confirm code meanings with SME.
Labor grade or pay band classification for the employee contact.
Base hourly pay rate associated with the contact; currency per currency_type.
Assigned work shift (e.g., day, evening); may influence premiums and scheduling.
Hourly premium added to the base rate (e.g., shift differential or certification pay).
Date/time of the most recent purchase order placed with this vendor.
Primary tax rate percentage applied to transactions for this contact; confirm jurisdiction and application rules.
Secondary tax rate percentage (e.g., county or city) applied in addition to primary tax; confirm rules.
Tertiary tax rate percentage applied if applicable; confirm usage with SME.
Timestamp when any field in this record was last changed in the system.
Foreign or functional currency reference for this contact; likely indicates an alternate currency; confirm definition with SME.
Customer account number assigned to this contact within the organization’s billing system.
Code defining how markups are calculated for this contact (e.g., percentage, matrix, tiered); confirm code meanings with SME.
Markup percentage applied to parts for this contact when pricing or billing.
Markup percentage applied to labor for this contact when pricing or billing.
Markup percentage applied to miscellaneous charges for this contact when pricing or billing.
Base cost used to compute priced parts for this contact (e.g., standard or last cost); confirm costing source.
Base labor cost used for pricing or cost calculations for this contact; confirm costing source.
Base miscellaneous cost used for pricing or cost calculations for this contact; confirm costing source.
Timestamp captured when a user last modified the record (user action time).
User account that created the record.
Timestamp when the record was created.
User account that last modified the record.
Timestamp when the record was last modified; audit field tied to user_id_modified.
